column4: Hi, I was wondering if anybody new if it was possible to run an ubuntu install and put root on a flash drive and /home would be on the computers HDD. Any ideas?
If you alter /etc/fstab on the live image to mount the drive (usually /dev/sda/directory_here).
I'm not sure if this is what you are asking, but you can mount just about any file system in Linux.  So you could mount just about any file system's directory as /home in /etc/fstab
Why not just multiboot, and put your /home on an nfs server or something?
